availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Principal office located at Frankfort, Kentucky. Chartered by the Commonwealth of Kentucky on February 20, 1839. President(s): Philip Swigert. Cashier(s): John B. Temple.
Branch office located at Covington, Kentucky. President(s): R. Pretlow. Cashier(s): Thomas B. Page.
Branch office located at Henderson, Kentucky. President(s): Joseph Adams. Cashier(s): T. D. Tilford and Leonard H. Lyne.
Branch office located at Maysville, Kentucky. President(s): Harrison Taylor. Cashier(s): James A. Johnson.
Branch office located at Mount Sterling, Kentucky. President(s): A. Barnes. Cashier(s): William Mitchell.
Branch office located at Princeton, Kentucky. President(s): P. B. McGoodwin and R. B. Ratliffe. Cashier(s): Caleb B. Henry.
Branch office located at Somerset, Kentucky. President(s): John M. Hail. Cashier(s): Eben Milton.

ab.bibl:
J. Smith Homans, ed., The Bankers' Magazine, and Statistical Register, vol. XII (June 1860): 995.
The Merchants' Bankers' Almanac for 1861 (New York: J. Smith Homans, Jr., Office of the Bankers' Magazine, 1861), 38.
The Merchants' Bankers' Almanac for 1863 (New York: J. Smith Homans, Jr., Office of the Bankers' Magazine, 1863), 20.
The Merchants' Bankers' Almanac for 1864 (New York: J. Smith Homans, Jr., Office of the Bankers' Magazine, 1864), 19. "An Act to Incorporate the Farmers' Bank of Kentucky," Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort, Ky.: A. G. Hodges & Co., State Printers, 1849), 7-20.
